boardgame.name: Pot o' Gold II
boardgame.description:
In Pot o' Gold II players compete to win four pots of unknown value.

Each of the pots is initially seeded with three face cards from one of two standard decks of cards. The remainder of these cards are used to play the game - each player receives a hand of ten.

On a turn a player plays any non-face card to a central pile; when the total value of the cards reaches 20 the player causing this gets an action (or two if they hit 20 exactly). Actions include placing a marker on a pot, moving a marker, looking at the cards in a pot, adding a face card to a pot, or re-rolling the die placed next to each pot, which will later subtract from its value.

Play continues until two players have each used all five of their markers, at which point the pots are scored. The player with the most markers on a pot gets the full value, the player with the second most gets half value. The value of a pot is based on the die, the number of markers, and the cards in it.

boardgame.name: The Long Way Down
boardgame.description:
You are Orpheus.

Overwhelmed with your sorrow over the loss of Eurydice, you have chosen to descend into the Underworld, praying that your song of grief and love can soften the hearts of its King and Queen and that they will allow you to bring her back to the living world with you. You know that it will be dangerous - the Underworld is no place for the living - and you know that much will stand between you and your love; but you are willing to risk it all to try. Armed with nothing more than your lyre and your love for Eurydice, you stand at the gates of Hades and descend into the Underworld.


Inspired by the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, The Long Way Down is a solo Wretched and Alone game that allows you to play out Orpheus' descent into the Underworld to find his love, and their journey back to the surface. Encounter denizens of the Underworld, compose your epic, and stay strong as doubt crawls into your mind.

Will you look back, only to lose her again?
Or will your resolve hold long enough for your to both make it out of the Underworld alive?

There's only one way to find out - but you'll have to take the long way down...

CW: The Long Way Down deals heavily with themes of loss, death, and hopelessness.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Game of Flying Obelisks
boardgame.description:
The Game of Flying Obelisks is played on a 9x9 board with two raised 3x3 "hills." Each player has a set of 17 pieces of 8 different types, and there are also 5 neutral obelisks.

On a turn a player moves a piece according to its specific movement rules. Moving to a space occupied by an enemy piece captures it. Moving to a space occupied by a friendly piece creates a stack; a stack can have up to three pieces (with some restrictions) and can move as any of the pieces in it.

By moving pieces to the opposite rank a player may recover lost pieces or acquire obelisks. Obelisks allow stacks they are with to teleport from one hill to the other. (Movement onto and on hills is fairly restricted.)

The object of the game is to capture the opposing globe (which moves like a Chess king) or to occupy both hilltops (the center squares of the hills) and have no enemy pieces on the hills.

Note: this was claimed to be a reconstruction of an ancient board game, but that was an April Fool's joke.

boardgame.name: Cataclysm at the Acaeum
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Cataclysm at the Acaeum is a megadungeon boxed set that is compatible with the First Edition game (as well as the OSRIC system). This boxed set will include four 36-page adventure books (each containing 4-6 scenarios), three 32-page adventure books (large scale adventure), 24+ cardstock maps and a poster map of the acaeum complex. There will also be a separate book detailing all significant NPCs, New Monsters and New Magic Items. When complete, this will be the largest boxed set produced for the First Edition game!

This is a sand box style megadungeon and it can be dropped into virtually any campaign setting including those originally published for the First Edition game or used with the upcoming Pacesetter Games & Simulations Dark Land campaign setting. Unlike many other megadungeons, Cataclysm at the Acaeum can be played as a massive campaign-style adventure or it can broken into pieces and used independenlty to fit your game. If used as a stand-alone campaign, you can start with first level characters. If not, there are adventures for various levels including 1-3, 4-6 and 7-9. In general, the adventures are designed for well-balanced parties of four to seven characters.

Adventure Background: The Acaeum is a citadel that is home to a secretive group that is devoted to the study of history, magic and the dieties of the world. Its members are generally magic-users, clerics, sages, collectors and scholars. Most are independent and concentrate on their own individual fields of study. But all share a thirst for knowledge of their world (your campaign world) and what mysteries it holds. The Acaeum citadel rests near the summit of a low mountian near the coast of a great ocean. While the citadel is the major feature of the mountain, many of the Acaeum members have their own chateaus on the mountain. Most also have private laboratories, libraries and vaults within the mountain itself. All have access to the Acaeum citadel which has its own massive complex beneath the mountain. The complex is so large, and old, few, if any, can claim knowledge of the endless series of halls, chambers and secret vaults.

For centuries the Acaeum membership have operated in seclusion, though only a very few actually reside at the Acaeum complex. Then came the cataclysm. An evil high priest managed to retrieve the Black Stone from some unnamed layer of the abyss. The Black Stone, now on the prime material plane, raised the dead and created armies of undead under control of the high priest. However, before the priest could march forth he was confronted and destroyed by an intrepid band of adventurers. Unfortunately, the hordes of undead, now free of control, immediately spread across the lands. The largest horde fell upon the Acaeum and devestation followed. Large sections of the moutain complex fell to the undead but total collapse was avoided. The core Acaeum complex remained free from incursion, though some sections were sealed off in a desperate attempt at defense.

News of the calamity spread quickly and, with the Acaeum defenses weakened, bands of humanoids and giants descended from the surrounding lands and laid seige to the citadel and those structures that had withstood the onslaught of the undead. The Acaeum is near complete collapse and only the bravest adventurers can prevent Cataclysm at the Acaeum!

User summary:

The PDF version is distributed as multiple PDF files, including:


CA0.1 The black stone (24 pages)
CA0.5 The Village of Lord (12 pages)
CA0.6 Crimson Sisters of Malice (32 pages)
CA1.0 Cataclysm at the Acaeum Sourcebook (44 pages)

boardgame.name: The Phylactery (Issue 2 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

This booklet is jam packed with page after page of heroic fantasy adventure influenced heavily by early third party RPG badassery like Dave Hargrave’s infamous Arduin Grimoire series and the early Dragontree Press stuff. The Phylactery 2 is meant to be a quick and easy resource that you can pull ideas and plot hooks from for use directly at your gaming table. There’s no fluff in here and nothing padding out the page count - just pure old school goodness created exclusively for the fantasy gaming community. We have absolutely JAM-PACKED a ton of RPG goodness in here for you.

boardgame.name: Dollar
boardgame.description:
Dollar is played with two decks of standard playing cards minus the court cards (one for each player) plus a supply of 199 points in tokens worth specific amounts (e.g. US coins).

Players have four-card hands and play "tricks" to win points; players each play one card with no restrictions and the higher card wins a token (which one depends on specific conditions). If there is a tie a token is added to the next trick, unless the cards are identical in which case the second player wins 25 points.

The object is to reach 100 points.

boardgame.description:

User Summary

A multi-chapter horror game. Two chapters were originally released when the game was in early access however it has now been taken down by Steam as it appears to have been abandoned since 2016.

boardgame.name: The Ring
boardgame.description:
The Ring is a card game loosely based on the US election process. It is played using a standard deck of cards, a small board, and some markers.

The game is driven by four columns of cards on the table, which each start with a single card. On a turn a player can draw a card from the deck, add a card to a column, or discard a card allowing them to take one or more columns: columns with a total exactly matching the discarded card and/or any combination of columns matching this may be taken.

For each column taken the player places a marker in the top box of an area on the events board (or five markers if they manage to take all four columns at once). There is a marker moving from area to area with each placement, so a player placing multiple markers places them in different areas.

Once all the spaces on the board are full the game ends. Players each one point per marker, except that markers on blue spaces are worth two. A player having the majority of the spaces in an area doubles their points for it. Players lose points for cards in hand. If there is a tie for overall points the lowest player is dropped and the board is re-assessed.

boardgame.name: In the Hollow of the Spider Queen
boardgame.description:
The great Spider Queen lies dead at the border of the human lands, laid low by the order of your mother, Queen Alyria.
​
Now, fearing for your life in the ensuing turmoil, you have fled the palace at Bastow, seeking the relative safety of anonymity on the open road.

What secrets will you uncover as you explore the continent you’ve never seen?

​What creatures will you meet, and how will your fates intertwine, for good or for ill?

​A complete roleplaying game for one GM and one player, set in a world of gritty fantasy where magic is slowly slipping away.

Inspired by old-school fantasy
Focused on nonviolent resolution
Random tables on nearly every page
Powered by the Apocalypse
boardgame.rpg: In the Hollow of the Spider Queen

boardgame.name: Verdammt Nochmal: Shitty ways to Die Edition
boardgame.description:
These cards are full of really bad situations, but you have to sort them according to the level of how bad the way of dying is.

All players start the game with 3 cards laid out in front of them. The player to the right of the starting player reads out a card from the draw pile. The starting player must then decide where the card fits into their set of cards according to the misery rating. If they guess correctly, they add the card to their set. Answer incorrectly and the player to their left may try.

Arrange 10 cards correctly to win the game.

boardgame.name: Forza Horizon 4: Fortune Island
boardgame.description:
Seek your fortune in the most treacherous Horizon expansion yet, where you will conquer extreme terrain, lightning storms, and perilous roads in search of hidden treasure. Embark on a new campaign, solve Treasure Hunt riddles, and carve your own path in new Trailblazer PR Stunts. Tackle the island’s twisting mountain switchbacks, ocean cliffside roads and rough terrain in 10 exciting new cars including the 2019 Lamborghini Urus, 2017 Ram Rebel TRX Concept, and the 2018 BMW M5. Earn 24 Achievements and 500 GS

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Clever Girl [Human Edition]
boardgame.description:
HUMAN EDITION: You play the solitary survivor of a devastating failure of park security. The dinosaurs are loose. You’ve seen people torn apart by merciless killers and trampled by herds of colossal beasts. You may not have done any killing yourself, but you certainly caused deaths in your haste to find shelter. Who might still be here if you had just stopped to help?

HUMAN VS. RAPTOR: You and a friend will each play one side of the story in a tense race for survival. Intertwine the stories of a human trying to survive long enough to go home and a raptor fueled by grief and revenge. Requires two tumbling towers and one deck of playing cards.

COOPERATIVE PLAY: Play together with a friend as human companions supporting each other or as raptor hunters out for blood. Will your bonds remain strong through the hardships and trials this island has in store?

PRINT-AT-HOME BOOKLETS: Clever Girl now comes with a color PDF for viewing on screens and a low ink version, both of which are formatted for at-home booklet printing. Just choose the "Booklet" option during printing! A folding tool and long-arm stapler are recommended.

boardgame.name: Malleus 1666
boardgame.description:
Malleus 1666 is a cooperative dungeon crawler board game for 1 to 3 players. In this game players control heroes intended to prevent the evil awakens from his ancient sleep.

This game uses dice for player attacks and cards for monster actions. You must explore room by room, complete missions, collect equipment (by destroying barrels) and defeat the final boss.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Name of the Beast
boardgame.description:
Warning
This work requests you to put yourself in the shoes of a political prisoner, or anyone incarcerated for politics-adjacent reasons.



While the text is intentionally distant, they are written to evoke fear and pain universally.



Therefore, this book comes with a warning for EVERYTHING.



If it terrifies, it will be here.
If it hurts, it will be used.



The Regime will find whatever they need to make you comply.



The Name of a Beast is an interactive fiction told in first person, and played via the Wretched and Alone system, based on Chris Bissette's The Wretched.

Two PDF versions are currently available (a dark mode and a light mode). Both are functionally the same (file size due to... reasons).

Submission to the Wretched and Alone Jam.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Dwarven Legacy - DW Compatible
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Dwarven Legacy

A Dungeon World Adventure for Group or Solo Play

Dungeon World is one of my favorite fantasy settings and equally at home used for GM lead groups or solo play, using any of the available oracles or sets of solo tools.

Dwarven Legacy is a tough adventure! As the screenshots below show, the biggest threat is a dragon! this adventure is not for the faint-hearted! The entrance to a dwarven complex has been recently uncovered by a landslide. What is not obvious is that the recent land shift has released something far more dangerous deep below the surface.

This adventure uses Jason Cordova's 7-3-1 method to set up the key elements of the adventure in a way that is very improvisation-friendly. This makes it easy to play as a GM and as a solo player using an oracle.

This is a 13 page PDF, two pages are cover and front matter. It is a layered PDF allowing you to turn off images for ease of printing. The is a separate file, allowing you to print in color or monochrome and to your choice of size.

boardgame.name: Assassins of the Vast Desert - DW Compatible
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Assassins of the Vast Desert

A Dungeon World Adventure for Group or Solo Play

Dungeon World is one of my favorite fantasy settings and equally at home used for GM lead groups or solo play, using any of the available oracles or sets of solo tools.

Assassins of the Vast Desert has the character(s) track a band of assassins back to their desert hideout. An artifact has been stolen, and the players need to get it back, one way or another.

This adventure uses Jason Cordova's 7-3-1 method to set up the key elements of the adventure in a way that is very improvisation-friendly. This makes it easy to play as a GM and as a solo player using an oracle.

This is a 13 page PDF, two pages are cover and front matter. It is a layered PDF allowing you to turn off images for ease of printing. The is a separate file, allowing you to print in color or monochrome and to your choice of size

boardgame.name: Roots of Evil - DW Compatible
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Roots of Evil

A Dungeon World Adventure for Group or Solo Play

Dungeon World is one of my favorite fantasy settings and equally at home used for GM lead groups or solo play, using any of the available oracles or sets of solo tools.

Root of Evil describes the descent into madness of a druid over the death of his sacred oak, and the dryad that lives with it. That tipping over the edge puts into place a chain of events that spiral into dark rituals before spilling out across the local communities. Something needs to be done, it is a time to call for heroes.

This adventure uses Jason Cordova's 7-3-1 method to set up the key elements of the adventure in a way that is very improvisation-friendly. This makes it easy to play as a GM and as a solo player using an oracle.

This is a 13 page PDF, two pages are cover and front matter. It is a layered PDF allowing you to turn off images for ease of printing. The is a separate file, allowing you to print in color or monochrome and to your choice of size.

boardgame.name: Solo Dungeon World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Solo Dungeon World
Playing Dungeon World without a Gamemaster

This booklet allows you to play Dungeon World without a gamemaster. These rules use a simplified yes-no mechanic designed to encourage the use of gamemaster moves.

Adventure and the Campaign Front is a central element of these rules. As you play the Fronts will be built up based upon the choices you make and how your game unfolds.

Although these rules are intentionally simple and easy to use, the booklet is 24 pages, and include plenty of examples and full colour art by Felipe Ganona.

These rules can use be used alongside the Dungeon World Oracle Deck by Brian Holland.

If you want to print this booklet, the page size is 6" x 9" inline with the core Dungeon World rules.

Solo is a perfect way to learn a new game, test your first adventures and going beyond just making characters when you are first getting to know the rules.

boardgame.name: Adventuring Alone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

It was recently pointed out to me that most solo role-playing appealed to GMs, as they were already used to improvising and creating content on the fly. Players are more used to improvising from prompts within the context of a scene. This is the 'What do you do?" question. This solo book is aimed at players, although GMs can use it just as easily. In creating a solo adventure it offers questions about the location, scenes, and encounters to encourage the solo player to engage with their version of any Hero Kids setting. A number of d6 tables aid the process of creating a spontaneous adventure.

These solo rules suggest a structure for each adventure that takes you from an event to engage your character, the plot hook, through to a final showdown with a villain, and a return home. At each stage, you will be asked questions about your character and the scene. Once you start solo role-playing you will just use the rules from Hero Kids (required to play). This is not a 'module' or numbered paragraph adventure. You will be improvising the entire adventure as you go.

Part of the inspiration for this set of solo rules came from this blog post: https://wispsoftime.com/content/rolling-solo-chapters-2-3-tu... which also uses Hero Kids as a simple starting solo game system.

Solo is a perfect way to learn a new game, test your first adventures and going beyond just making characters when you are first getting to know the rules.

The entire contents of this supplement are available in the full-size preview. Please take a look and make sure you think you can play this way or are prepared to give it a go. Solo role-playing can be extremely satisfying and challenging, in a good way.

These rules require Hero Kids to be used and are not intended to be used by young children, they are designed for role-players who want to try solo role-play and use Hero Kids as a simple system to get started with.

boardgame.name: Sole Survivor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Sole Survivor
Solo RPG Rules for Apocthulhu

Apocthulhu is probably my favorite Cthulhu Mythos RPGs. Too many CoC games ended with my investigator dead and the mystery unsolved. Apocthulhu is different. It takes place after the bad guys won. The cultists were right and possibly R'yleh has risen. We are then into a post-apocalyptic game but rather than zombies or a nuclear wasteland we are dealing with a mythos spawned apocalypse setting.

Apocthulhu is derived from various OGL sources, such as Legend, and uses a very familiar d100, roll under your skill mechanic. One of the key features of the setting(s) is the scarcity of resources. The core oracle in these solo rules mimics the scavenging skill resolution and that carries on through to controlling NPCs in your world, and for running published adventures.

This solo set contains a page on safety tools, this may strike you as odd in solo play, but I felt that there was a place for them in this genre.

This is not a big set of rules, the page count says 25 pages, which is 22 pages of supplement and a 3-page OGL license.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Alsace
boardgame.description:
The famous trivia game.

The questions are about the region of Alsace in North-est France.

3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geography, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.

boardgame.name: Capers Solo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

These rules add solo roleplaying as an option for Capers by Nerdburger Games. You will need the core Capers rules to use this book.

Capers is a 1920s themed Supers game using a simple playing card game mechanic in place of dice for random events.

These solo rules use cards for emulating the role of Game Master.

Oracles & Seers

The Oracle is used for questions that are answered yes-no. The suit gives you the base positive or negative and the pip value or face adds shades of grey to the answer.

The Seer is used for more abstract questions, those that are not answered yes or no. What are they talking about? What is in the safe? These more narrative style questions all fall under the Seer. The Seer uses the suit for a sphere of influence such as physical or mental and the pip value for the action.

These simple rules make for a fast and light solo experience that feels very much like the original Capers game.

Solo is a perfect way to learn a new game, test your first adventures and going beyond just making characters when you are first getting to know the rules.

boardgame.name: Theatre in a Box: Return Season
boardgame.description:
The Return Season expansion is another 220+ cards to immerse yourself. This pack contains more singing, more dancing, more acting, more trivia and even more tears and cheers.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trial of the Altered Beast
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Altered Beast is dying, slowly succumbing to the passage of time. While their story is set to end, there is a way they can yet live on. Through merging minds with a willing subject, the altered lineage can continue, but only if the subject is worthy. Only if they survive the Trial of the Altered Beast.

///\\
Trial of the Altered Beast is an adventure for use with MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: Aggrieved Village Guardian
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In times now forgotten, these totems were erected to protect the village from demons and evil spirits. After centuries of thankless service, they had enough. They became the very things they were meant to defend against.

boardgame.name: The Mad Haberdasher
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Mad Haberdasher is an NPC for MÖRK BORG inspired by Roger Crab, created for the FÖLK-LORE community jam.

boardgame.name: Imperial Glory
boardgame.description:
The player manages the Ancient Kushan Empire of India and Central Asia.

Using a deckbuilding system, each player has a deck of advisors including generals, governors, diplomats, artists, architects, philosophers and secret agents. Each type allows distinct types of actions. The player can accept the initial card draw, or push their luck by spending precious influence hoping to draw a card the empire needs more.

After determining the action, the player allocates funds (talents) and determines the result via random draw of a result counter. But in the case of invasion, a more elaborate sequence plays out on the Battle Board using a brand new combat resolution system.

Based on how well the turn went, the emperor gains or loses an unknown number of popularity points, the player keeps or loses influence points, and gains or loses an advisor.

Finally, players draw one of the momentous Fate cards, which can even lead to the death of the emperor. When this occurs, popularity converts to influence and cards enter and leave the deck based on the differing interests of the new emperor. When the last emperor dies, the game ends and the player scores points based on the empire's achievements at that time, conquests, but also cultural achievements and economic development.

Features named emperors with historical stats and descriptions, a wide array of army types, army maintenance, unrest, rebellion, nonplayer barbarians, civil wars, heresy, pandemic, trade, temples, monuments, aqueducts, roads, rules to control a nonplayer in combat, and more.

This is the first in a series of games to eventually include the ancient Roman, Parthian and Han Chinese empires, each player having to cope with the game system as well as each other.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: What's Wrong With Me, Doctor?
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You’re obviously infected, but with what? Monkey Pox? Weeping Plague? Gods save you if it’s the Black Fits.

A random generator to add descriptions to infections in MÖRK BORG or other grim fantasy roleplaying games. Now you know not only what disgusting, disfiguring symptoms you are exhibiting, but also what your agonized death will look like once the sickness runs its course…

boardgame.description:
Cambrai III – A Panorama of Hell Bourlon is a GWASL Module and includes BONUS publishers choice counters, special rules and 8 scenarios set on the historical map provided.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 and 2 required.

Scenarios:
Bourlon, Pas-de-Calais, France

A Day Out – November 23rd 1917
Stick Close, But Not Too Close – November 23rd 1917
Remember Spion Kop – November 23rd 1918
Hold Or Die – November 23rd 1918
Mighty Little Men – November 24th 1917
Arwyr Bach – November 24th 1917
Hell’s Last Issue – November 24th 1917
Hunting Party – November 25th 1917
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: Cambrai II – Black Friday: Fontaine

boardgame.name: Dragon (No. 3 - Jan/Feb 1992)
boardgame.description:
Dragon Magazine
No. 3
Janvier / Février 1992

boardgame.name: TERMINUS: The Final Journey Of A Legendary Hero
boardgame.description:
Fate comes for all, even for legendary Heroes...

You are a demi-god, using your powers to make a difference in the world - but your death has been prophesied by The Fates, and each breath moves you closer to the end of your journey.

How will you spend your last days? Will your legend be remembered?

TERMINUS - The Final Journey Of A Legendary Hero is a solo journaling RPG about performing heroic deeds and making peace with one's death.

This game is inspired by Greek Mythology, epics and tragedies (and Disney’s Hercules).

Content Warning: Enclosed inside, you will find themes that relate to fear, isolation, despair, violence, the inevitability of death, and facing one’s regrets and mistakes.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: TERMINUS: The Final Journey Of A Legendary Hero

boardgame.name: Tower of Heaven
boardgame.description:
Tower of Heaven is a solo-game where you play as an ex-angel who for Love, wants to break into heaven. It's in a collaborative choose-your-adventure-esque style, where the protagonist is asking you to help them tell their exploration of heaven that is both supernatural and mundane.


This was created for Wretched & Alone Jam and uses a tumbling block tower & a tarot deck to simulate the ongoing tension of the ex-angel's status in heaven as well as inspiration and prompts of what is unfurling in each of it's levels.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Dragon (No. 4 - Mar/Apr 1992)
boardgame.description:
Dragon Magazine
No. 4
Mars/Avril 1992

boardgame.name: Don't Let It Die: Hindrance
boardgame.description:
For as long as anyone can remember, the nearby mountains have been covered in a thick layer of ice, making it impossible to climb. So it comes as a surprise to the group when you see the ice has melted away, revealing the rocky exterior and unlocking the mountains precious resources for those brave enough to ascend its dangerous terrain.

The Hindrance expansion brings the following new features and content to the game. You can find the Hindrance logo on either the front or the back of the new content to help identify it.

This is an expansion for Don't Let It Die and includes...

- 4 Unique characters, some with special items and tokens.

- 16 new Night Event cards.

- 24 Hindrance cards.

- 32 new Discoveries to modify the Fire Knowledge Tree.

- 3 new Resource types (Gemstones, Eggs and Herbs)

- A new Resource deck, Explore.

- 14 new Weapons, Tools and Buildings.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: When Glamour Dies
boardgame.description:
It is the night that you’ve been waiting for.

It's up to you where and when it will happen, and it is also up to you what will exactly happen that night, but you are sure that suits, tuxedos, and gowns will be a thing, so does elegance, glamour, and fun.

It goes on for hours, and you ponder that nothing will ever go wrong. Maybe someone will vomit on the floor, but that's normal if someone's drunk or full, right?

You are wrong.

Maybe you are the only one noticing it, maybe there are others that knew as well.

The thing is that tonight may not be the best night ever.

At least for you.

You will be remembered, at the very least.


when glamour dies is a GM-less journaling RPG for 1-2 players, where you try to survive (and find answers + solutions) at the night that you thought will never go wrong.

Requires a 6-sided die, 12 tokens (of any kind), a deck of cards (Jokers included), and some sort of medium to record your experiences.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Semino
boardgame.description:
Semino is a game of chance and strategy. Victory goes to the player who can grow their plant the quickest.

—description from the back of the box

Each player rolls a die and moves their bamboo tube across a grid, collecting marbles in the bottom. Each marble collected pushes colored leaves up to the top until it fully blooms.

Two difficulty levels are included:

Players may collect marbles of any color.
Players can collect marbles only of their own color.


—user summary

boardgame.name: Liar's Clue
boardgame.description:
Liar's Clue is played using six number and six court cards from a standard deck and a reference sheet for each player. Six hands each consisting of one number and one court card are dealt: one to each player, one face-down on the table, and one face-up on the table. The object of the game is to deduce the cards in the face-down table hand.

On a turn a player asks an opponent any question about their hand that they want, as long as it can be answered with "yes" or "no." However, the player being questioned does not necessarily tell the truth - the reference sheet tells them whether to tell the truth or to lie, based on which number card they have and which player is asking the question.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Adventures: Klingon Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

This FREE 37-page Klingon Quickstart for the Star Trek Adventures roleplaying game provides a summary of the key rules needed to play through the quickstart adventure, the adventure “The Tip of the Bat’leth,” and six pre-generated Klingon warrior player characters, all ready for your game group to use to battle for glory and honor.

You will also need:
• At least two 20-sided dice (d20) per player, and several 6-sided dice (d6) to serve as Challenge Dice
• A set of six chips or tokens for Momentum
• At least twenty chips or tokens for Threat
• The pre-generated characters found in the back of the booklet

Now, ready your disruptors and bat’leths, download the quickstart adventure, gather your friends, and enter Star Trek Adventures from the Klingon point of view! Qapla’!

boardgame.name: Dragon (No. 12 - Jul/Aug 1993)
boardgame.description:
Dragon Magazine
No. 12
Juillet / Août

L'encyclopedie des mondes imaginaires

boardgame.name: Ruin Raiders
Ruin Raiders - Unknown Menace
boardgame.description:
RUIN RAIDERS is a turn-based tactical roguelike in which you command military squads on a no return journey into the secret-packed ruins of an ancient civilization. Master turn-based combat, craft new technologies and deepen yourself further into the ever-shuffling ruins to unveil the past!

Travel through different floors, from the top of the ruins to the demon-packed depths. Face unique bosses, unlock new races, upgrade your raiders, weapons and items, and find old writings to put together the story of the catastrophe.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Stormwing: Wanderer Gamebook+ Book One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

You are Stormwing, an agent of the Yeorseggr sworn brotherhood. A hero in the vein of Lone Wolf and Cub or The Mandalorian, you go where the innocent need you to be and protect them from the horrors of this world. When wreckers sink your ship you wash up on the icy shores of Kalbud, a northern frontier town. Slay giants, avenge yourself against pirates and start to unravel the mystery of the sinister Bloodshapers!

Inspired by such classics as Joe Dever's Lone Wolf and Ian Livingstone's and Steve Jackson's Fighting Fantasy series, the Wanderer system takes gamebooks to a whole new dimension. As a "gamebook+" this title contains a narrative section, as well as rules to help you take your adventures off the rails. Generate your own enemies, traps, treasures, dungeons and bosses for even more dangerous and exciting tales.

There are guidelines for turning your own adventures into gamebooks, which you can then trade with friends and collaborate to create something new and fantastic.

boardgame.name: The Iron Uprising
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Step into a world of adventure when you join the Iron Uprising. You play as Snurri, a lowly dwarf on a quest to liberate the oppressed people of Eldrafell from a wicked king.

To accomplish your mission you need to free prisoners, destroy weapons factories and upgrade your power suit to overcome new opponents.

As part of the GamebookPlus line, this book contains a full solo roleplaying section that allows you to continue your adventures indefinitely after you play through the main story. There are even guidelines for compiling, sharing and collaborating on stories with friends!

This title is set in the same universe as our previous book, Stormwing, but you do not need to play either of those books in order to enjoy the others.

boardgame.name: Halloween Hustle
boardgame.description:
Halloween Hustle is played with a standard deck of cards and a supply of candy (or other small items).

At the start of each hand each player receives four cards and a supply of candy is placed in the center of the table: one less than the number of players.

The dealer draws a card from the deck and then passes any of their cards to the player on their left, who then passes any card to the next player, and so on; the player to the right of the dealer ends up discarding a card. In the meantime the dealer draws and passes another card, so players end up all passing cards at the same time. Discards are shuffled when the deck runs out.

When a player has four cards of the same rank they take a piece of candy. All other players may then also take a piece. Starting on the second round the player left without a piece is eliminated from the game. After a player is eliminated, of one player has more candy than anyone else they win. Otherwise another hand is played.

A player may pretend to be about to take a piece of candy to fake out other players. If another player takes a piece in this case, they must give it back along with a piece they already have.

Variant rules are provided for younger children.

(The game says up to 13 players can play, but there's no way to get the game started in that case.)

boardgame.name: The Widow's Tale
boardgame.description:
The Widow's Tale is a solo journaling RPG, made using the Wretched & Alone rules by Chris Bissette and Matt Sanders.

You are the widowed queen of a dying kingdom, sealed in your enchanted palace whilst the armies of your enemies lay siege to your gates. As your protective sorcery fades and the castle crumbles, you wander the empty halls and desperately attempt to research a spell which will let you send for aid.

It wasn't meant to end like this.

This game was made as part of the Wretched & Alone jam.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Wickies
boardgame.description:
You are wickies, both of you, light-keepers employed by the United States Light-House Establishment. Your job is to tend to a lighthouse far off the coast, and make sure the light is lit every night.

You have both been brought to this barren rock on a tender ship, to serve your four-week stint before you are relieved.

You are neither of you strangers to hard work, but the days and nights do take their toll. As the weeks go by, will you keep it together or will you turn on each other? What lies beneath the waves? What strange power does the lighthouse hold? What secrets do you keep from each other?


Wickies is a 2-player GM-less rpg based on the Wretched and Alone rules by Chris Bissette and Matt Sanders. You take on the roles of lighthouse keepers, one of you will be the older Keeper, who is in charge, and one of you will be the younger Assistant.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: A Wretched Luncheon With Your Best Friend Who Sucks at Cooking
boardgame.description:
Your best friend wants to cook an unforgettable luncheon for you. They are very excited about this idea. You are less excited about this idea, since the last time your friend cooked for you, they burned down your kitchen.

You have formed a compromise: the cooking will take place in your friend’s house, not your own, and you will have the right to check in on them every ten minutes – just so long as you don’t actually open the kitchen door. You also intend to keep a log of key events for the sake of posterity.

A solo+ TTRPG about friendship, stubbornness and kitchen fires, based on the Wretched and Alone SRD by Chris Bissette. You will need a 6-sided die, a deck of standard playing cards with the jokers removed and either a tumbling block tower or set of tarot cards. Includes a 2 player option.

Cover image by Noel Bauza, sourced from Pexels (licenced under CC0).

Content Warnings
The core premise of the game is of kitchen fires played for comedic effect, though there is no loss of life or large-scale property damage. The text contains swear words. Some prompts relate to a fictional soap opera with common tropes such as illness, non-permanent character death and non-graphic violence. Feel free to skip any prompts which cause you discomfort.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: A Wretched Luncheon With Your Best Friend Who Sucks at Cooking

boardgame.name: You Are A Volcano
boardgame.description:
You are a volcano. You have come a long way from the ocean floor, erupting and building up new rock slowly throughout eons. Eventually, the top of you emerged from beneath the water and your lava began to form an island around you. Some plants and animals arrived over time, whether under their own power or brought to you by the wind and the waves, and you enjoyed watching them spread across your surfaces and flourish. All the while you continued to erupt, slowly building your island.

Recently, a violent storm blew several boatloads of creatures towards you, and you held your lava in, trying not to hurt them as they crashed on your shores. When they emerged from the wreckage of their crafts, they started building structures on you and establishing a new society. You relaxed and allowed your lava to flow again, but it didn’t flow as freely. You feel that there is pressure building up inside of you that might someday cause a massive eruption, and now you are trying to find a way to release this excess pressure before it dooms the inhabitants of your island.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Operation Lens Nord – Eastern Front Partisan Warfare
boardgame.description:
Operation Lenz Nord was conducted April 4th through April 13th 1943, in the area around Borisov, in the Gavja river valley, some of the actions involved the villages of Korkeyka, Zarinek, Starniki, Dworzez, and Zabashevichi.
The area was thick forest, swamps, peat bogs, and many of the little villages were on low hills, like islands among the bogs and water logged forests.
Home the Partisan Regiment “Bolshevik” the Germans found a challenging adversary in the vast formidable terrain of central Russia.

Operation Lenz Nord – Eastern Front Partisan Warfare updates the map and situations from the former "Bandenkreig"

Ownership of ASL-RB, CH's NATIONALITY Sets providing Waffen SS and Partisans - AND ownnership of any editions of modules that provide 5-2-7/3-3-7 Russians and 5-4-8/4-4-7 SS MM

Scenarios:

When the Odds were Even - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 12th 1943
Death’s Magnet - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 8th 1943
Ivan’s Farm - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 11th 1943
Chaos in Haste - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, July 1st 1944
Swamped with Partisans - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 9th 1943
The Road to Orsha – Outside Orsha, Soviet Union, June 24th 1944
Defeat in the Peat - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 8th 1943
Derbun’s Command Post - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 13th 1943
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: ASL Comp: Bandenkrieg – Hell Behind the Eastern Front

boardgame.name: A Profane Tome
boardgame.description:
You are a powerful and evil mage (or warlock, wizard, witch, or any label). You have been a student of the dark arts and spent your life learning and researching spells, rituals, incantations, magic of all kinds. It is now time to write your Grand Grimoire. This will be your Magnum Opus, an epic tome that will make any user powerful beyond imagining. But it will not be easy.

You have barricaded yourself in your tower (or dungeon/castle/study) with all your research and notes. You have food and supplies and are protected from any others looking to prevent such an evil book from being written. You are in for the long haul, you either emerge the most powerful mage in history with a Grimoire worthy of your name, or die trying.

A Profane Tome is based on the Wretched, by Chris Bissette. The original game is available here.

Wretched & Alone games are solo journaling games about struggling in the face of insurmountable odds to survive, or to achieve something important.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: By the Sounding Sea
boardgame.description:
You are the eldest child of a middle-class family in 1800s England. Despite the weight upon you to marry well and bring prestige and security to your household, you have made a grave mistake and incurred your family’s scorn.

Your punishment has sent you on a pilgrimage into the moorlands to your deceased aunt's expansive manor which looks out over the sea from a tall, sheer cliff. Throughout the halls of this empty home, the sea echoes. It beckons to your subconscious, begging you to give in to your already blooming despair.


"Come to me.
Be with me.
Drown in me."


You can only hope that the distractions are enough to keep the ocean out of your mind, that all of your hard work will be worth it somehow. You only need to last until your family retrieves you.


That is, if you can resist the waves for that long.


Content Warning: physical and social isolation, mental health (especially depression and psychosis), suicide, unreality, and familial abuse.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Shape of Your Heart
boardgame.description:
You are the eldest child of a middle-class family in 1800s England. Despite the weight upon you to marry well and bring prestige and security to your household, you have made a grave mistake and incurred your family’s scorn.

Your punishment has sent you on a pilgrimage into the moorlands to your deceased aunt's expansive manor which looks out over the sea from a tall, sheer cliff. Throughout the halls of this empty home, the sea echoes. It beckons to your subconscious, begging you to give in to your already blooming despair.


"Come to me.
Be with me.
Drown in me."


You can only hope that the distractions are enough to keep the ocean out of your mind, that all of your hard work will be worth it somehow. You only need to last until your family retrieves you.


That is, if you can resist the waves for that long.


Content Warning: physical and social isolation, mental health (especially depression and psychosis), suicide, unreality, and familial abuse.

Source: The Developer Website.

1514 the board game, was designed to mark the 500th anniversary of the Battle of Orsha.

1514 is an epic board game for two, four or six players.

Become the head of the Muscovite army or forces of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania.
Roll the dice, move your troops, take part in battles and follow orders from the cards.
Tactics and luck, combine infantry, cavalry and artillery regiments and win the victory!

The game must involve an even number of people - 2, 4, 6:

2 : players go in turns, one kind of troops per turn (for example, the first move of player №1 - infantry, the second move - cavalry, the third move - artillery, then again infantry, etc.).
4 : the players are divided into two camps - the Moscow army and the Lithuanian army. Artillery figures are not involved in this version of the game, so one player controls one type of troops. The game takes turns (for example, the first move of player №1 for the Moscow infantry, the second move of player №2 for the Lithuanian infantry, the third move of player №3 for the Moscow cavalry, the fourth move of player №4 for the Lithuanian cavalry).
6 : the players are divided into two camps - the Moscovite army and the Lithuanian army. Each player controls one kind of troops. The game takes place alternately (for example, the first move of player №1 for the Moscow infantry, the second move of player №2 for the Lithuanian infantry, the third move of player №3 for the Moscow cavalry, the fourth move of player №4 for the Lithuanian cavalry, the fifth move of player № 5 for the Moscow artillery, the sixth move - player №6 for the Lithuanian artillery).


Gameplay:
In your turn, roll the dice and move your figure to the number of points received. Subsequent game actions depend on where you are on the field.
Troops of one army can stand on one space.
If, after throwing the dice, your figure ends in a space with an enemy troops, a "Battle" begins.
When on the red or black box, take a card of the appropriate color and follow the steps described in it. If, as a result of the orders executed on the card, you are again on the red or black field, you do not need to take the card a second time.

Combat:
If you receive a "Fight!" Card, then your moving figure and the nearest (on either side) opponent's figure start the fight. You and your opponent roll the dice at once - who gets more points wins. The defeated army that took part in the battle goes as many steps back as the points thrown by the winner during the battle. In case of a tie the combat is held again, until victory.

Victory:
The winner is the one who first brings to the enemy's camp his entire army, of figures of infantry, cavalry and artillery.

boardgame.name: The Final Voyage of the Edmund Fitzgerald
boardgame.description:
Take part in the famous last voyage of the Edmund Fitzgerald, a transport ship that capsized during a storm in 1975. This is a solo journaling game based off Chris Bissette's Wretched & Alone game system. All you need to play is a block tower, a six-sided die, a deck of cards, and something to document your adventure with.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: The Final Voyage of the Edmund Fitzgerald
boardgame.rpgartist: NOAA's Office of Coast Survey Historical Map & Chart Collection

boardgame.name: I'll Hold Them Off
boardgame.description:
Your mage companion warned you that if you went forward with this plan, you were almost certainly doomed. If The Evil didn’t destroy you, the isolation and strain likely would. Both of you hoped it wouldn’t come to this, but alas, it has.

As all battles do, this will end someday.

You just need to hold on until the bitter end.

I’ll Hold Them Off is a solo journaling RPG written using the Wretched and Alone rules by Chris Bissette and Matt Sanders. You play as a fantasy hero who has been sealed in a magical realm with an ultimate Evil that you couldn’t defeat, trapped in a perpetual duel with them until the seal breaks. You need to keep fighting until the next group of heroes comes prepared to defeat it once and for all. Will you survive long enough to give them a fighting chance and make it home?

This game can be played alone with a standard deck of cards, dice, a way to record your experience, and a few hours of time. It can also be modified to create a sidequest or solo adventure for a player character in a preexisting fantasy campaign.

Content Warnings: Captivity, fear, isolation, betrayal, suspense, false or distorted perceptions of reality, despair, trauma, natural disasters, violence, and death.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Overcoming Solipsism
boardgame.description:
A word of caution:

This is a very dark and grim game. Some of the topics that it covers upon include paranoia, social exclusion, feelings of isolation, gaslighting or depression. If any of this topics is likely to affect you in a negative manner, please refrain from playing the game.


Overcoming Solipsism is a game of paranoia and self-inflicted social exclusion.



“One of the things that makes Wittgenstein a real artist to me is that he realized that no conclusion could be more horrible than solipsism.”

-David Foster Wallace






You've always felt it. Out of the corner of your eye, the world dissolves. The people you see, they cease to exist as you move away. The only thing you can be sure of is that YOU exist, and that's not nearly enough. You could be a brain in a jar, sitting in someone's lab. The world could be a simulation. You could be the star of a reality TV show that you are not aware of.

Whenever you think about it, you get the same sensation; the chances that THIS is all real are slim. Most of the world—people's reactions, politics, economics—doesn't make sense at all.

In this game you will try to have a normal, healthy life, despite the overpowering feeling that nothing is real. Will you let your acts be driven by paranoia, or will you focus on making the world a better place?

WARNING
This game includes themes of social exclusion and mistrust that might be disturbing for some players. Discretion is advised.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Magical Kitties Save the Day! Boxed Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb'
Magical Kitties at a Glance
An all-ages roleplaying game of cute, fierce, cunning kitties. Use your magical powers to solve problems and save humans from terrible troubles!

What's in the Box?
The standard version of Magical Kitties Save the Day includes everything you need to play the game.


Game box with shiny spot UV
Velvety flocked interior tray
Magical Kitties Save the Day Rulebook
The Big Adventure (solo adventure)
River City (hometown)
River City poster map
6 blue dice
48 kitty treats
Pad of 50 full color pre-printed character sheets

boardgame.name: Magical Kitties Save the Day! Deluxe Boxed Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb'
Magical Kitties at a Glance
An all-ages roleplaying game of cute, fierce, cunning kitties. Use your magical powers to solve problems and save humans from terrible troubles!

What's in the Box?
What's in the Box?

The Deluxe Edition of Magical Kitties Save the Day is packed full of high-quality component upgrades (wooden tokens, custom dice) and a bunch of bonus content, including the Magical Power, Talent, and Flaw Cards.


Game box with shiny spot UV and a foil box sleeve
Velvety flocked interior tray
Magical Kitties Save the Day Rulebook
The Big Adventure (solo adventure)
River City (hometown)
Alien Invasion (hometown)
Wild Ones (hometown)
River City poster map
Alien Invasion poster map
The Wild Ones poster map
6 large custom kitty-paw dice
48 wooden kitty treats
Pad of 50 full color pre-printed character sheets
36 full-color Magical Power cards
36 full-color Talent cards
36 full-color Flaw cards

boardgame.name: My Soul to Keep
boardgame.description:
My Soul to Keep is a solo, gm-less journaling game in which you play a young child plagued by night terrors and struggling with their faith. You will deal with challenges and abuses during the day and translate your traumas into the horrors that haunt your dreams. You will draw cards and write journal entries based on specific prompts in order to craft a story about faith and doubt. Is the real threat the monsters under the bed or your parents' religious fundamentalism?

This game is based on The Wretched by Chris Bissette and was created for the Wretched & Alone Jam.

Content Warning: This game includes themes of child abuse, religious trauma, fear, isolation, and unreality.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: No One Goes Alone - Playing the Game
boardgame.description:
The HMS Solitude is an expedition vessel with its own accompanying deep sea research submarine, The Exile.

At the bottom of the deepest ocean, the submarine is lying helpless in the unfathomable depths. After bringing a strange artifact on board, the engines were destroyed, stranding the crew in the dark. At first they suspected sabotage, but then the deaths began.

One of you is the only surviving member of The Exile. The crew are dead. You are alone. You are running out of air. You have one lifeline to human contact, a daily transmission to your partner on the HMS Solitude.

One of you is the communications officer aboard the HMS Solitude. You are the only lifeline to The Exile. Can you keep your partner stable as you float powerlessly above?

Will you rescue them before they succumb to the pressure?

Or will the creature get to them first?


This game is based on The Wretched, you can find that game here: loottheroom.itch.io/wretched

The Wretched is a game about human resilience in the face of overwhelming odds and almost certain death. It is a game about Isolation, fear, and perseverance.

In this game, No One Goes Alone, you play as a Team. One of you will use The Solitude Manual, and the other will use The Exile Manual.

Together you will explore how connection with another person brings hope, no matter how dark the depths...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: No One Goes Alone - The Solitude Manual
boardgame.description:
The HMS Solitude is an expedition vessel with its own accompanying deep sea research submarine, The Exile.

At the bottom of the deepest ocean, the submarine is lying helpless in the unfathomable depths. After bringing a strange artifact on board, the engines were destroyed, stranding the crew in the dark. At first they suspected sabotage, but then the deaths began.

One of you is the only surviving member of The Exile. The crew are dead. You are alone. You are running out of air. You have one lifeline to human contact, a daily transmission to your partner on the HMS Solitude.

One of you is the communications officer aboard the HMS Solitude. You are the only lifeline to The Exile. Can you keep your partner stable as you float powerlessly above?

Will you rescue them before they succumb to the pressure?

Or will the creature get to them first?


This game is based on The Wretched, you can find that game here: loottheroom.itch.io/wretched

Together you will explore how connection with another person brings hope, no matter how dark the depths...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: No One Goes Alone - The Exile Manual
boardgame.description:
The HMS Solitude is an expedition vessel with its own accompanying deep sea research submarine, The Exile.

At the bottom of the deepest ocean, the submarine is lying helpless in the unfathomable depths. After bringing a strange artifact on board, the engines were destroyed, stranding the crew in the dark. At first they suspected sabotage, but then the deaths began.

One of you is the only surviving member of The Exile. The crew are dead. You are alone. You are running out of air. You have one lifeline to human contact, a daily transmission to your partner on the HMS Solitude.

One of you is the communications officer aboard the HMS Solitude. You are the only lifeline to The Exile. Can you keep your partner stable as you float powerlessly above?

This game is based on The Wretched, you can find that game here: loottheroom.itch.io/wretched

In this game, No One Goes Alone, you play as a Team. One of you will use The Solitude Manual, and the other will use The Exile Manual.

Together you will explore how connection with another person brings hope, no matter how dark the depths...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Petrichor: Collector's Edition
boardgame.description:
Petrichor is the earthy scent produced when rain falls on dry soil. The word is constructed from Greek (πέτρα) petra, meaning "stone", and (ἰχώρ) īchōr, the fluid that flows in the veins of the gods in Greek mythology.

Welcome to the lush world of Petrichor; you are a cloud. Your entire purpose in life is to expand, sire other clouds and water crops. Unfortunately, your mates (who are also clouds) have a similar plan. It’s up to you to manipulate the weather and assimilate these rogue clouds to contribute to the growth of as many crops as possible - all in order to claim the title of Most Valuable Cloud.

Petrichor is a highly interactive board game, playable by 1-4 people (up to 5 with the expansion, see below). It’s an action selection/area influence game, with 4 simple actions which interact with the various fields in ever surprising ways. The players move clouds with water droplets, and then rain those droplets onto specific fields, to make sure they have the right amount of water for the Harvest. During a Harvest, crops that have been watered enough are scored! Players are able to influence when, and how often the harvest happens. Players need to strike a fine balance between maintaining control of the different fields as well as influencing Harvest, to make sure the two come together at the optimal time.

This Collector's Edition comes with a new Artwork and includes the Flower, Honeybee, Greener Pasture Expansion.

boardgame.name: Minderheiten Quartett
boardgame.description:
This satirical card game features 60 minorities structured in 10 groups. Earlier editions are completely revised.

Minderheiten Quartett is a variant of a Quartett game, with a splash of Top Trumps and some unique mechanisms thrown in. There are two types of cards. First, the traditional Top Trumps style cards with minorities and their statistics, such as intelligence or sex appeal. Second, there are 6 Joker Cards which may change the scoring.

Every player receives 3 minorities cards and a joker. The starting player defines a category and "low" or "high". All players choose a card simultaneously. The player with the highest score chooses 2 of the played cards and puts them on his victory pile. All other players except the last one choose one card. Players then restock their hand to three cards. The game ends when one player has 4 cards of the same minority in his victory pile. This player wins.
A variant suggests to find the most discriminated person by discussion.

boardgame.name: Domino Bagger, Lok & Co.
boardgame.description:
With backhoe, locomotive, fire truck, shovel loader, tractor, dump truck, and concrete mixer there are seven different vehicles in this domino type game. In each case, the same motifs are placed next to each other. Who has the matching vehicles and manages to be the first to put all his domino cards?

The game is played clockwise, starting with the youngest player. On your turn, you look to see if you can match one of your tiles with one of the tiles in the middle of the table. The tiles can only be placed at the two open ends of the domino queue. Only identical motifs may be placed, for example, locomotive to locomotive or concrete mixer to concrete mixer.

If you have a matching tile, you may place it. Then it's the next player's turn.
If you don't, you must take a tile from the draw pile. If this tile you just took is a match, then you may place it on the table immediately.

The game ends when a player has played all tiles. The game also ends when none of the players can place a card. The winner is the player who has the fewest cards left.

Hirelings can be added to games at any player count. With fewer players, the hirelings add new pieces to the map, ramping up the tension and giving you more tactical options. With more players, some hireling cards will flip over to reveal new special abilities to gain, letting you explore unique and powerful strategies.

boardgame.name: Stewpot: Tales from a Fantasy Tavern
boardgame.description:
Stewpot: Tales from a Fantasy Tavern is a collection of small games for groups of three or more players. Each game lets you, a retired adventurer, play out different parts of running a tavern and settling down in a town together with your old adventuring party.

You'll be scrambling to cook something edible with random ingredients, bartending for troubled souls, calming down a tavern brawl, going shopping for all the things a tavern needs, and more in a variety of slice-of-life scenes! Typical play time depends on your group and how long you spend on each game. Most likely, the shortest playthrough will be about a 3 hour session, and a longer playthrough may take multiple sessions.

Stewpot takes design inspiration from similar mini-game collections such as The Sundered Land, Mobile Frame Zero: Firebrands, and The King is Dead by Meguey and Vincent Baker.

boardgame.name: Sight Words Challenge Grade 1: Sled Spin Out! Board Game
boardgame.description:
A fun way to learn sight-words, build vocabulary, and increase reading fluency!

Includes:
Game board with 40 sight words
10 write and wipe cards
4 write and wipe markers
4 pawns and one die

conforms to ASTM D-4236

OBJECT: Be the first player to complete all of the sentences on your game card.

SETUP: Have each player choose a game card, a pawn, and a write & Wipe marker.

HOW TO PLAY: Place your pawn on the "start" space and roll the die to decide who will go first. Whoever rolls the highest number starts, and play proceeds to the left.
To play, roll the die and move your pawn that many spaces along the board.
When you land on a space, say the word aloud then look over your game card to see if you can use the word in one of the sentences on your game card.
If you can use the word, write it on your card with the marker, then read the sentence aloud. Players should decide whether the word makes sense in the sentence. If you cannot use the word, play passes to the next player.

HOW TO WIN: The first player to complete all of his or her sentences is the winner! Continue moving around the board until someone wins, even if you pass the start space.

boardgame.name: The Black Oak
boardgame.description:
You are an investigative journalist, down on your luck and at the end of your rope. You got let go from your news agency and haven’t gotten any meaningful work for several months, so the bills have piled up and you’re about to be thrown out of your already crumbling apartment. You know that if you don’t find a case to close soon, you’re not going to get another chance.

The Black Oak is a solo GMless journaling game in which you play a destitute journalist trying to solve a strange murder. You'll have to struggle against the weather, starvation, and the influence of the black oak itself if they want to have a chance of solving the case.

This game is based on The Wretched by Chris Bissette and was created for Wretched Jam. The Black Oak is directly but loosely inspired by Safe and Also No Fear by Slaughter Beach, Dog.

Content Warning: This game contains themes of violence, suicide, decay, poisoning, financial distress, loneliness, implied or expressed body horror, and other adult content. Please enjoy safely, and let me know if anything comes up in your play that you feel should be added to the content warning list. Thank you!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Dusk Before Dawn
boardgame.description:
You are but one of only a few of your species still remaining in this world. As climate change begins to rapidly bring about disruption and turmoil, you have no choice but to migrate to new pastures. Though the climate is not the only challenge awaiting you. New creatures, similar to you in some ways, but very different in others, are migrating as well. For them this is their dawn, and for you and your kind, dusk approaches.

In this solo journaling game you are a member of a species in decline. Your world is changing and extinction is rampant. Not only are there environmental challenges abound, but to make matters worse a new apex species is on the rise. Time is running out for you and your kind, and the prospect of survival lessens with each lunar cycle.


The Dusk Before Dawn is a game about loneliness, perseverance, and survival in a world that is no longer suited for your kind. You are not human, but rather are a precursor to them. You will face overwhelming odds in your bid to outrun extinction.

At minimum, all you will need in order to play is the downloadable PDF of all the rules and vital information, a deck of cards, a 6-sided die, a writing utensil, and a piece of paper. To experience the game at its fullest you will also need a tumbling block tower and a coin.


Safety

This game includes themes of fear, isolation, suspense, despair, violence, and death.

Read and play with caution, keeping in mind that you can take a break or stop completely at any time. Your mental health is important, and this is just a game.

This game is designed to make success very difficult and very unlikely. It is meant to be challenging and harrowing and emotional. If that doesn't sound fun to you, that's absolutely fine.

Remember that you can change, ignore, rewrite or abandon any part of this game that you want.

Source: The Developer Website.

TENSION - The victim's video message and other digital web content turn the detective game into a multimedia puzzle game for the whole family and friends.
INVESTIGATORS - Thanks to the involvement of real murder investigators and real locations, the parlor game promises an exciting story and a unique adventure.
INTERNET - The crime thriller game is suitable for up to 8 players, ages 14+. You need internet access and an email address to solve the murder case.
INSTRUCTIONS - You can immediately follow the trail of the perpetrator - without any instructions! The exciting Escape Room game is also perfect as a gift for crime fans.

boardgame.name: Tit Albert dans Villaz
boardgame.description:
Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is a fascinating and extremely simple game system!
The peaceful Vilaz is invaded by the Tit'Albert who devour the Vilazwas one by one.
If no one reacts, it is otut le Vilaz that is threatened! The game continues until the Tit'Alberts are eliminated or the Vilaz is emptied of its inhabitants.

A turn-based game alternating day / night cycles, the story of Vilaz is told by the Storyteller, who will put the Vilaz to sleep and wake up the actors of this story to play a specific role in this confrontation between the players.
Play as a Tit'Albert to eat the Vilazwas or Cliffeeeeurd the White Hunter, take the lead of the Vilaz by becoming the Sef'Vilaz and eliminate every day a player you suspect to be a Tit'Albert.

Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is based on Mauritian folklore which describes the myth of the werewolf. Each character in the game comes from local folklore and represents an icon from Mauritian culture.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Bagration – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1944
boardgame.description:
Bagration: German is the third German themed book in the Flames Of War Late-war series of army handbooks (after D-Day: German and D-Day: Waffen-SS).
It is also the second of the Bagration series, bringing you German Eastern Front forces fighting against Soviet Operation Bagration as featured in Bagration: Soviet.

Bagration: German covers the German forces fighting all across the Eastern Front from Finland in the north to Romania and Hungary in the south from January 1944 to January 1945.

There is a great variety of formations and units available to field, from tanks and armoured infantry to grenadiers and tank-hunters.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

listing.notes: In 1944 the war in the east had become critical for the Germans. Determined defence, reinforced with local counterattacks, typified their fighting all along the front. Panzer division ‘fire brigades’ were rushed from one hot spot to another. German Generals such as von Manstein, Hube, and von Saucken showed expert skill holding back the Red Army against overwhelming odds, extracting their forces from encirclement, holding Soviet breakthroughs, and delaying the enemy advance at important bridgeheads. Fighting erupted all along the front as the Soviets launched Operation Bagration. From Narva in the north, through Byelorussia where the Red Army wedge hit the hardest, down to Romania and Hungary, the German fought for every inch of ground.

Prentice is my entry for the Wretched & Alone Jam. You play as the apprentice to a powerful spellweaver, whose death has left you trapped in their arcane sanctuary. Your mentor's magic held this place together, and without them, it is crumbling. You are a lowly apprentice and don't know the ritual to exit from this magical realm. boardgame.name: TERXO
boardgame.description:
Terxo is an abstract alignment game, the more innovative tic tac toe evolution.

(1)build a 3x3x3 cube: at the end, the player who score more points is the winner of the match!

Each dice is different from the others, everyone have a specific Dice-Color, an impressed Sign, and Sign-Color)

(2)You score a point when 3 pieces are sharing one characteristic in common (same dice color, same sign, or same color of the sign)

(3)Aligments Are allowed in every linear direction throw the cube

(4)You can score more than one point at the same time, for example, if you score in more than one direction or two characteristics on the same direction.

Players doesn't have specific pieces, but the avaible pieces and the building cube are for all.

(5)at each turn you receive the piece you have to play from the previous player.
After positioning your piece and declared how many points you score, you have to chose from the avaible dices the next dice you want to give to the next player!

(6) each piece has to be placed in contact with pieces already placed (contact by placed above, on the side or by corner).

This way you never know, from the start, in which direction the cube will develop.
(7) Do not position pieces over the third dimension (by sides or hight)… The final shape must still be a cube.

(8) Pieces can not to be moved after being placed.

(9) 2 players - Pl.1 VS Pl.2
3 players - Pl.1 VS Pl.2 VS Pl.3
4 players - (Pl.1 & Pl.3) VS (Pl.1 & Pl.3)
(in 4, players plays in two teams with alternated players)

Terxo, This Board Less Board Game is a complete information game with high strategy and easy rules

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Walls That Keep On Growing
boardgame.description:
This is a solo journaling game in which you document your journey and discoveries within a shifting, seemingly endless underground labyrinth. You woke in a strange room with few fragmented memories of a past you tried to run from: there are no doors in sight, but you find rooms, hallways, secret passages and sets of stairs as you make your way through this unknown underground system. With plentiful supplies and resources filling up the rooms you pass whenever you need them, your only time limit is how long you can stand to be here. Your goal is to find a way out... and to uncover your connection to the walls you have found yourself in.

What do you remember about the life you left behind?

What do you hope or fear lies ahead?

What do the places you pass through mean to you?

Where do you plan to go when you reach the exit?

The gameplay of The Walls That Keep On Growing is based on The Wretched, product of Chris Bissette and Loot The Room, and was created for Wretched Jam.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: The Walls That Keep On Growing

boardgame.name: Thou Art Damned
boardgame.description:
Thou Art Damned is a solo journaling RPG made using the Wretched & Alone rules system by Chris Bissette and Matt Sanders.

You play as a clever magician driven by their own desires. A long time ago, you made a deal with a demon, and got everything you ever wanted. But it couldn't last. Now, your time has run out, and the demon eagerly waits to collect your soul. With each day that passes, you come closer and closer to losing everything you love. In your final days, you seek a way out of the contract, and a way to save your soul.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: WE ARE GONE, or The Long Walk To Wretched Bay
boardgame.description:
Your expedition to this vast north has gone awry and must be abandoned. Your dreams of glory are a distant, mocking memory; now all that matters is survival, pursuing the narrowest possible chance of survival. Your ship lies paralyzed in the ice behind you, while before you stretches the impossible trek to the dubious safety of the whaling station at Wretched Bay. Godspeed you, Captain, and Heaven preserve you.

Made using the Wretched and Alone system, but utilizing a can of spam instead of a block tower, this is a 1-person journal RPG in which you play as the Captain of a doomed expedition, trekking back across miles of ice, pursuing the faintest hope of survival. Document your travels through the detritus your expedition leaves behind as it makes its long, slow, agonizing way back to Wretched Bay.
boardgame.rpg: WE ARE GONE, or The Long Walk To Wretched Bay

boardgame.name: NetWords
boardgame.description:
NetWords is a word game played using only paper and pencil. No maximum number of players is given.

The game starts with an agreed-upon number of letters, each written in a circle, with the circles connected by lines. The players also agree on the number of letters that will end the game and the minimum word length.

On a turn a player may add as many connections as they want between existing letters that aren't already connected, as long as none of the lines cross existing lines. Also, each connection must result in at least one new word, which the player claims (they may claim more than one). Words are spelled by following the connections - a connection can be traversed more than once, and each letter has an implicit connection to itself.

After adding as many connections as desired a player ends a turn by adding a new letter with a single connection to an existing letter. This need not result in any new words.

Claimed words score their length minus the minimum word length. However, there are some additional rules on claiming longer forms of earlier words and so forth, which affect the scoring.

After the last letter has been added players may examine the network to find additional words to claim.

boardgame.name: Detective Stories: History Edition – Kaifeng 982
boardgame.description:
Betrayal, Insurgents, and a looming war…

The discovery of an thousand year old ancient Chinese artifact shines new light on the assassination of Chancellor Lài – an event that changed the fate of the Xi Xia Empire forever. Professor Dan Silvers starts the search for the truth which has been buried since 982 AD.

But alone in a foreig country he hits the wall - can you help his investigation from afar?

The first in a series of detective games based on historical events which not only history buffs will love. The game is designed as a historical criminal case and requires investigations similar to those carried out by archaeologists in real life. Use the collected evidence and make your own investigation to bring the truth to light.

—description from the publisher
