boardgame.name: Dino Dodge: Survival of the Fittest
boardgame.description:
~STORY~
65 million years ago, the Earth was dominated by Dinosaurs. They lived together in peace and harmony. Always being kind and courteous to their dino neighbors. That is…until the meteors came…

Now it’s every dino for themselves! Push, shove and dodge your way out of falling meteors! Do whatever it takes, even if it means moving another dino under the meteor, to be the Last Dinosaur on Earth!

~OBJECTIVE~
Play Action Cards to dodge falling meteors, move your enemies under meteors and avoid new threats. Meteors fall by utilizing its ticker. Whoever is under a meteor and cannot escape are eliminated from the game.

Manage your hand carefully or leave your fate in the claws of your enemies. Meteors continue to fall and the world turns into lava, as the age of extinction lays way for only one dinosaur left standing!

~SPECIFICATION~
AGES: 8 and up
PLAYERS: 2 – 5
DURATION: 15 – 30 minutes
GAMETYPE: Competitive
MECHANICS: Take that, Hand Management, Free-For-All
REPLAYABILITY: Yes

LAUNCHING ON KICKSTARTER SOON:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bluegeargames/dino-dodg...

boardgame.name: Gin-Go
boardgame.description:
In a Rummy style of play, put down your spreads and place your chips to match each placed card. Two opponents (or teams of two) play from either end, in a tit-for-tat strategy trying to knock off each other's chips using card spreads to build a connecting link from their Ace to King row. Build your link, break theirs and hold that link until the hand is played out is what makes Gin-Go an exciting, fun and challenging game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Visitor of Reduction
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A constant storm seems to be over the village of Leirbag. The constant downpour started some weeks ago after yet another newborn disappeared, the family being aware of it early in the morning.

To top it off, nobody is allowed to the cemetery and place of prayers. The followers say that currently no further visitors are allowed as they are focusing their energies and prayers on the disappearances and further visitors would only disrupt it.

Based on the M’Boi Guaçu story from the missions’ or reductions’ in South America. In Tupi, M’Boi means snake and Guaçu, means big, so it is understanding that you can have different stories carrying the same name for the creature and portraying different characteristics.

This is the traditional story of the giant snake of Saint Miguel reduction.

Two pieces inspired by galician folklore for use with MÖRK BORG.

&

Made for the FÖLK-LORE jam.

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3 - Bounty of Blood
boardgame.description:
WELCOME TO GEHENNA

Once a long-gone company's testing ground for weaponry and biological experiments, the dusty wastes of Gehenna are now lorded over by genetically modified beasts and their keepers, the vicious Devil Riders gang.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3 - Psycho Krieg and the Fantastic Fustercluck
boardgame.description:
CONQUER KRIEG'S CONSCIOUSNESS

Krieg's imagination is a dangerous place, filled with memories of slain enemies and the manifestations of deeply repressed demons. You'll have to team up with both of Krieg's opposing personas—a raging murder machine and a calm inner voice—to make it out alive.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Warrior Zone
boardgame.description:
Warrior Zone, a game of attrition, where players use the “strategy-of-chance” to gain victory. With each game a different battlefield where players ruthlessly eliminate their opponents. Take your five best warriors into battle, attacking and defending with a unique dice system in both hand-to-hand, short-range, and long-range combat. Gain experience, heal, or feel the wicked wrath of the unexpected.

Be the One To Stand Where All Have Fallen!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Silent Hill
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Silent Hill franchise has been around since 1999, spawned three sequels, a prequel, an Arcade game, and a feature film, and yet a roleplaying supplement could not be found. Being a role-playing enthusiast, I tried to find any information I could on Silent Hill, and it’s monsters in order to begin a modern campaign set in the town; but aside from some monster stats which I discovered on various RPG forums, I was disappointed to find that nobody had compiled the information, and made it into a comprehensive guidebook.
...
This supplement was created without license, and was created for fans of the Silent Hill series by fans, and should therefore remain free.
...
While making this supplement, I used a lot of artwork found throughout the internet. I did not ask permission to use said artwork, and I’m sure most of it is copyright to its respective artists. However, to be fair, I’m not getting credit for all of my hard work on this supplement either. Neither of us is making money of this, so let’s call it even and live and let live. This supplement is by fans for fans. Please keep this supplement free.

boardgame.name: Nostradamus: The Last Prophecy
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A supernatural point-and-click first person game where you play as Madeleine the daughter of Nostradamus as you attempt to catch an assassin disguising their crimes as prophecies.

boardgame.name: RX squad
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling shooter with customizable weapons.

boardgame.name: The Return Home
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A FPS where you play as rabbit thrown out of it's home by lizards who comes back for revenge...

boardgame.name: Dawn of Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
Dawn of Kingdoms is a worker placement (with a new twist), resource management, tableau building, area control game!

Dawn of Kingdoms is a game that is riveted with intense decisions that are made difficult due to their importance and lasting effects!

Raise your Kingdom to its fullest potential by choosing wisely where to place your two workers each round (1 king and 1 queen).
After placing their workers everyone collects their respective resources, tokens, points, and building blueprints. They then have an opportunity to build a building from their blueprint collections.

Points can be acquired in a variety of ways. Through area control on the map, hidden victory points from political buildings, from the worker placement board, and from special circumstances due to a constructed building.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Latino Card Revoked: First Edition
boardgame.description:
A hilarious, laugh-out-loud trivia game about Latino culture written by comedians, Glorelys Mora and Tori Pool.
Whether you identify as Latino, Latina or Latinx - if you can't answer these questions, you might just need your card revoked.

One player reads a question with multiple choice questions, A-D. The others put down a card indicating the choice they believe is correct. Players start with 10 points and lose a point for every incorrect answer.


Plays up to 6 people
Includes 81 question cards
24 response cards
Safe for family play
Comes in a white box

boardgame.name: Surround!
boardgame.description:
Surround! is played on any kind of grid; six example grids are provided including standard square, hexagonal, and triangular grids.

On a turn a player colors in one grid space. The object is to completely surround any connected group of spaces of the opposing color (including just a single space) with your own spaces and/or the edge of the grid. Spaces do not connect at the corners.

The game is stated to be intended as an introduction to Go.

boardgame.name: Abyss: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for Abyss with expansions. It fits sleeved cards.

boardgame.name: Altay: Dawn of Civilization
boardgame.description:
Designed by Ole Steiness and Paolo Mori, and beautifully illustrated by Finnish artist Paulina Hannuniemi, Altay-Dawn of Civilization will bring players to an age before time, when civilization is emerging from the mists of a legendary past.

In a secluded region, deep in the heart of a vast continent, for endless years four mysterious people have been developing different cultures, merging magic and technology, in a delicate balance with nature and among themselves.
Now, they must face a challenge: the arrival of new settlers, bringing with them more advanced crafts and technologies, new weapons and fighting techniques, and an entirely different lifestyle.

As the leader of one of the original inhabitants of Altay, how will you react to the challenge? Will you be open to accepting the new settlers and merge with them, or will you focus on your ancient traditions? Will you expand your kingdom or develop new knowledge? Will you build monuments to last forever, or crush your enemies with your armies?
There are many paths to victory in Altay-Dawn of Civilization!

Altay - Dawn of Civilization is an original blend of deck-building, civilization development, and area expansion.
Players control one of four different factions - each represented by a different starting deck, with subtle differences in the number of "basic" cards and including unique cards for each faction.

In each turn, players will use their cards to produce resources (stone, metal, wood, knowledge), build new settlements and expand on the board, attack or defend from their enemies - or manipulate their decks or card hand.

The gameboard represents one of the regions where the four people are in conflict with each other, with each area characterized by a different terrain type and the presence of different resources. Card-playing and board expansions are fully integrated, as many cards will have greater effects if you control the right territories.

Using the resources produced by their cards or collected from the board, players can acquire and add to their deck new cards, representing the new settlers and their crafts.

Players can also spend resources to develop "Achievements," special cards which are permanently added to a faction, granting it additional capabilities or providing victory points to the players.

Victory is granted by the combination of territorial expansion, technological development, and the success in creating long-lasting memories of your civilization's achievements.

—description from the designer

Łąka: Rudzik (karta promo)
boardgame.description:
Expand your Meadow collection with Robin promo card!

Shuffle Robin into one of decks, try to create a perfect environment for him and add him to your meadow to make it even richer.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Meadow: Cards & Sleeves Pack
Na louce: Set obalů & promo karty
Łąka: Koszulki z zestawem kart
boardgame.description:
Take care of your Meadow and protect it with special card sleeves! The set includes 300 transparent sleeves in Meadow cards size, providing protection from dirt, moisture and loss of color. Additionally, there is an “R” envelope with 6 cards as a mini-expansion to the game!
Cards & Sleeves pack is a language independent expansion for Meadow.

What is Meadow?
Meadow is a board game in which players take the role of wanderers watching nature. Equipped with a map, they stroll through the picturesque surroundings, looking for inspiration and capturing breathtaking views. Players are driven by passion and curiosity, but also by competition for the title of the keenest nature observer! It will be awarded to whoever scores the most points from the observed species of animals and plants, landscapes and souvenirs collected from the hike. Competition continues by the fire, where players compete in achieving the goals of their expeditions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Runes Way
boardgame.description:
Runes Way is a deck of 31 hexagonal cards that are designed primarily for playing games in the live action role-playing (LARP) world of Empire which is run by Profound Decisions. Players do not need to know anything about LARP, The Empire or runes to enjoy the games.

Runes Way comes with rules for three quick and simple real-time mini-games designed by The Guild of Good Games called The Way of The Runes, The Runes of The Way and Runic Skein'. There is a further turn-based solo or cooperative game challenge called Paragon's Path. The cards can also be combined together into The Runes Way Labyrinth puzzle that forms an elaborate structure with hidden meanings for those who seek its secrets. Finally, the cards may also be used for divination purposes using the Wheel of Meaning method of Rune-Reading.

The Runes Way cards each feature six runes from the world of Empire. One of the runes on each card will match exactly one other rune on any other card - this is a similar feature to that used in the game of Dobble where one symbol on every card matches a symbol on any other card. The Runes Way cards may be placed adjacent to each other to connect matching runes along adjoining edges, enabling cards to be connected into a line - this has similarities to how pieces connect in dominoes. Since the shapes of many of the runes are very similar, it can be challenging to quickly spot which runes match correctly.

There are 2 similar but slightly different standard editions of the Runes Way deck (the Blood Red Runes Edition and the Empress Lisabetta Memorial Edition). These may be combined together to increase the number of players who can play the different games, and to add variety and additional challenge to the gameplay.

boardgame.name: Scientific Barbarian (No. 2 - Winter 2020-21)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Post-Apocalyptic Game Megazine You Didn’t Know You Needed!

Since the premiere issue was a big hit, we’re back with SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2! Now with 100% newer gaming content that you can drop right into your post-apocalyptic, sci-fi, or fantasy genre-mash role playing game. 9 out of 10 wasteland warriors agree, you don’t want to go into an ancient science installation without one.

We are extremely proud of the creative team we gathered for issue No.1, and now they are all back for SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2 — plus a few exciting additions! We’ve got a mini-adventure by James M. Spahn (The Hero’s Journey, The One Ring, Star Wars), fiction by James M. Ward (Metamorphosis Alpha, Gamma World, 77 Lost Worlds), and more great stuff from Levi Combs (Planet X Games), Skeeter Green (Skeeter Green Productions), Tim Kask, Travis Hanson, and Jolly Blackburn.

boardgame.name: Rolling Dice
boardgame.description:
In Rolling Dice, the interior of the game box becomes a dice arena, with a cardboard ice floe stuck in place to give you a spot upon which to land your dice and one side of the box removed to make it easier to roll your dice.

Each round in the game, you roll three or four dice onto the ice floe. If you rolled four dice, then you choose one die to leave on the floe, removing the other three dice from play. If you rolled three dice — because one of your dice was on the ice floe from a previous round — then you must choose a just-rolled die that has a higher number than your previously-placed die or a just-rolled die that has gone farther on the ice floe than your previously-placed die. If you throw all your dice too hard and land in the "water" around the ice floe or you fail to roll higher or farther than a previously-placed die, then you place one die as a penalty on an ice block to the side of the board.

Once all players have rolled in a round, whether with three dice or four, players score. Whoever has a die on the ice floe scores points equal to the sum of the pips showing on their die AND all the pips showing on dice that didn't go as far on the ice floe AND all the pips showing on dice out of play on ice blocks. Score bonus points if you're on a fish net and lose points if you're on an ice hole. (If you have a die on an ice block, you do not score this round.) Thus, the farther you roll on the ice floe, the greater your scoring potential — not to mention the potential of landing in the water.

After scoring, start a new round beginning with whoever was first to place a die on an ice block, with all players once again rolling either three or four dice. The game ends the round that a player reaches or exceeds a certain point threshold, then the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #4 - Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the map of the trailblazer, scarab scourge, pyroclastic rod, and elixir of mutable flesh!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like hieroglyphic barrier, funeral pyre, dying curse, and threefold moons of Thoth!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the Explorer, Jester, and Desert Nomad with new feats like Fairy Blessing!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the alchemical ooze swarm, graven guardian, and caller in darkness!

boardgame.name: All For Snotberry Wine (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Snotberry Festival is not to be missed! But it requires snotberry wine. So, what are the goblins to do when somebody steals an entire cart full of
snotberry wine...that human traders have already partially paid for. Obviously, we need to find the brew. Your characters are hired to recover the
wine and, ideally, the thieves...preferably dead. Otherwise, the humans are going to skin the trader alive. Well, you don’t care about that.

You do care about the money he’s offering.

All For Snotberry Wine is an adventure for Seasoned goblins in the Dark Hold setting. It is intended to be run in a single session.

boardgame.name: All For Snotberry Wine (SW)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Snotberry Festival is not to be missed! But it requires snotberry wine. So, what are the goblins to do when somebody steals an entire cart full of
snotberry wine...that human traders have already partially paid for. Obviously, we need to find the brew. Your characters are hired to recover the
wine and, ideally, the thieves...preferably dead. Otherwise, the humans are going to skin the trader alive. Well, you don’t care about that.

You do care about the money he’s offering.

All For Snotberry Wine is an adventure for Seasoned goblins in the Dark Hold setting. It is intended to be run in a single session.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Cerebeast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a couple of goblin kids come out of the deep tunnels squealing about monsters, Chief Talon Bulbousfoot demands the PCs investigate and deal with the monster. They find, perhaps, more than they bargained for - monsters in plenty and a creature to make the bravest goblin drop their bladder and run!

boardgame.name: Temple of the Twin Serpent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some Things are best left forgotten… but some of them should not have been!

A sinkhole has opened up on a farmer’s property, exposing a secret left behind by the worshipers of an evil god. Are you up to finding out what it was?

The Temple of the Twin Serpent is an adventure designed for low-level characters. But make no mistake ~ one false move, and they could be dead… or worse!

boardgame.name: Catalogue of Wondrous Treasures: Volume 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its fourth volume of objets de magie for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find over two dozen newly discovered magical items and artifacts for GMs to add to their campaigns:

Ammunition of Replication
Arrn Kerym, Sword of the Storm
Banner of Protection
Beaker of Plentiful Potions
Boots of Balance
Conduit Disks
Discus Shield
Distance Weapon
Druid’s Ring
Dust of Disappearance
Earring of Understanding
Fighter’s Ring
Gemstone of Ideas
Golden Apple of Idunn
Golden Sword of Battle
Heart of the Lion
Hel Shoes
Liquid of Purification
Mask of the Warrior
Owl Staff
Penny of Luck
Potion of Chromatic Hues
Potion of Power
Robe of Disguise
Rod of Metamagic
Rodger’s Hammerstein
Steel Bow of Everdeen
Tome of Arcane Mysteries
Weapon, Reckless Abandon

boardgame.name: Battlefield Manipulation Talents
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to use teleportation magic to more lethally shunt enemies around the battlefield? Suck away the elements from a nature-caster? Damage your enemies with bullets of pure vaccum? All this and more can be done with Spheres Apocrypha: Battlefield Manipulation Talents!

Made for Spheres of Power and Pathfinder 1st edition.

boardgame.name: Saturday Night Fever
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L’azienda di strumenti musicali “Spine” sta per lanciare sul mercato, in collaborazione con la Milhar, una nuova tipologia di strumento musicale: la chitarra glifica.
Ne ha quindi regalato un modello alla band blues “Manalite Giants” e sponsorizzato un tour di concerti in tutti i locali più famosi di New Olson.

L'improvvisa notizia del massacro della band costringe i Dipartimenti a muoversi immediatamente per evitare isteria e disordini.

boardgame.name: Tempi Supplementari
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Durante le scorse settimane una fabbrica di glifomotori e un magazzino di Manalite sono stati prosciugati dell’energia arcana. I proprietari credono si tratti di sabotaggio industriale, ma il Dipartimento Rivelatori sospetta sia coinvolta una qualche attività criminale di stampo magico. Per questo, diverse squadre composte da Persecutori e Rivelatori, sono state appostate in vari luoghi a rischio. In questa domenica pomeriggio tutte le strade sono deserte a causa del campionato di Calcio Ferino che si sta tenendo allo stadio della città di Rebirth, mentre la vostra squadra è una delle “fortunate” scelte per fare gli straordinari.

boardgame.name: Caso stasi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nel grigio della notte, la torre del distretto si è illuminata due volte di un violento magenta che squarcia il buio della città. Crimini di magia!

I membri del Dipartimento Ordine continuano a vegetare negli uffici, consapevoli che non li riguarda: ciò che riguarda l’arcano compete a qualcun altro.

Per questo, l’urlo dell’ufficiale coglie tutti alla sprovvista: “Branco di stronzi, scollate il culo dalle sedie: tutte le squadre devono mobilitarsi ORA!”

boardgame.name: A Christmas Crime
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Christmas Crime è il nostro secondo Dossier natalizio che regaliamo a tutti voi agenti per festeggiare al meglio il Natale!

Un anziano signore si è presentato al Dipartimento, confessando l’omicidio di tre cittadini scomparsi. Maggiordomo di un’antica villa di famiglia, ha patteggiato la condanna, in cambio di informazioni su dove siano i corpi. Il Dipartimento ha accettato la mediazione, per poter concedere alla famiglia delle vittime una sepoltura degna.

Pronti a scortare il vecchio Scrooge in una fredda notte invernale?

Buon gioco Agenti! E ricordate: Scarta, Mangia e Festeggia!

boardgame.name: Thalia's bloom & other futuristic missions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A prototype for time travel,
a routine mission goes awry,
the wreckage of a legendary comet-breaker…
And a mysterious stone !

At the end of each month, discover the "Monsters of the MONTH", containing all the scenario from the past months, but implemented and augmented, exclusive hand-outs and a special scenario !
All the scenario included are quick to read and easy to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.


Un prototype pour voyage-temporel,
une mission de routine tourne mal,
l'épave d'un brise-comète légendaire…
Et une pierre mystérieuse !

A la fin de chaque mois, découvrez le "Monsters of the MONTH", contenant tout les scénarios du mois, mais augmenté, des aides de jeux exclusives et un scénario spécial !

Tout les scénarios sont rapide à lire et facile à ajouter à vos soirées jeux, que ce soit pour complèter une campagne en cours, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrit pour un système ou un univers spécifique, afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les adapter au besoin.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: La floraison de Thalie & autres missions PDF
Thalia's bloom & other futuristic missions PDF

boardgame.name: Dungeon Entrances (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of tools to help you give your dungeons evocative and exciting entrances. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Dungeon Entrances is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Postmortem Giallo: The Sisters of the Seven Sins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third in our Giallo mini series, Sisters of the Seven Sins provides an Italian-style pulp adventure centred around a band of nuns who are not, quite, what they seem.

System agnostic, but presented for Actual F*cking Monsters.

boardgame.name: Murder, Mayhem & Lollipops
boardgame.description:
Murder, Mayhem & Lollipops is a darkly comedic competitive card game in which players collect weapons that they will later use to assassinate targets. The player with the highest total value in assassinated targets and unused weapons and other items wins the game.

On a turn, a player must perform 3 actions. This could either be revealing a target, killing a target by spending weapon(s), aqcuire items through flipping a card over or taking them from a deck or another player, or discarding candy to get more actions.

boardgame.name: Zyborg Commando Resurrection Overdrive
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

ZYBORG COMMANDO RESURRECTION OVERDRIVE is a roleplaying game of a dark future, where an invasion of giant robotic insects and their masters is only opposed by you and your comrades - undead cybersoldiers risen from the grave on a mission of vengeance.

ZCRO is "Starship Troopers" meeting "Return of the Living Dead" while chewing a piece of "Bubblegum Crisis" and rocking out to a soundtrack by "The Misfits." It's a war of horrors with Hollywood-style tactics and combat, but it's equally about trust, shadows, torments, and the struggle against a never-ending Hunger. Come on - take a bite.

boardgame.name: Taelmoor
boardgame.description:
Taelmoor is a cooperative dungeon crawling and storytelling game. It ties together physical boards, cards, and standees with a smartphone app using scan-and-play technology. Each scenario typically involves a combination of exploration, puzzle solving, storytelling, and combat in a classic sword and sorcery setting.

Games of Taelmoor begin with players selecting an archetypal class (i.e wizard or rogue), and forming a party by joining the host's game with their smartphone or mobile device. Players then take turns exploring and interacting with the game world. New rooms are laid out tile by tile as they are explored, and each may include unique elements like NPCs to talk to, puzzles to solve, or combat. The story is relayed simultaneously to all players via the app, though players are encouraged to read new passages aloud as they are discovered.

Combat features simplified deck construction elements. Each class has unique strengths and weaknesses, and can build a custom combat deck as they level up throughout a scenario. Strategy between players is emphasized as many attacks become more powerful when combined with others. Attacks are played by scanning the physical card and then discarding.

Scenarios typically take 60-90 minutes to complete. Some are broken into multiple parts and are meant to be played across separate sessions.

boardgame.name: Gubat-Banwa: The Warring States of Kitatak
boardgame.description:
Gubat-Banwa: The Warring States of Kitatak is a tactical combat and war drama roleplaying game set in a heroic fantasy setting inspired by Late Porcelain Period Philippines.

You play as Manggugubat, warrior-braves that make up the warrior caste, followers of Datu, who enjoy prestige and regard oftentimes higher than their noble counterparts. As Manggugubat, you must define why you fight in this land of perpetual battle.

As a tactical combat roleplaying game, you should expect deep and rewarding combat encounters that focus on neat tricks, battlefield effects, and grid combat in the same vein as Final Fantasy Tactics, Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together, and Dungeons and Dragons 4E, with a system of roll under d20 that features trying to roll under your attack stat but higher than your target's Defense, to streamline and simulate Hit Chances in Tactics RPGs.

As a war-drama roleplaying game, expect an emphasis on relationships with other warriors, with your loved one, and intense interpolity politics with the other polities. Gubat Banwa expects you to play into these melodramas: sons having to kill their fathers for defecting to an enemy polity, daughters having to flee to the mountains to escape misogynistic responsibilities, loved ones killing each other slowly due to orders and/or emotions, best friends dueling at the top of a mountain in the midst of a storm as their ideologies bring them to a head. This features systems of game that focus on action and consequence, with a 4d4 rolling system meant to invoke the casting of lots with crocodile's teeth that Precolonial Filipinos would do.

This game is made for war stories, the likes one would see in Final Fantasy Tactics and Tactics Ogre. It’s about being forced to kill your closest loved one in the middle of a blood-stained sea in the midst of a storm because they serve a Datu that blasphemed your Sultan. War Drama narrative mechanics make sure that violence happens inevitably, in one way or another, all threads intertwining and coming to a head with tactical combat.

boardgame.name: The Howling Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This scenario involves a treasure hunt into the Upland Marsh in Sartar, a treasure hunt that has been instigated by an ancient map…

This pack contains: the 34 pp pdf Scenario, two printable maps, a players map handout, a section with plans & tokens for vtt play.

boardgame.name: Walking a Bloody Path: The Battle of Fallen Timbers, August 20, 1794
boardgame.description:
“The trail has been a long and bloody; it has no end. The pale faces come from where the sun rises, and they are many. They are like the leaves on the trees. When the frost comes they fall back and are blown away. But when the sunshine comes again they come back more plentiful than ever before.” –Little Turtle’s remarks, August 14, 1794.

Following defeats in 1790 and 1791 in the Northwest Territory the US Government authorized the creation of a standing army to invade and subdue the area. Appointed in overall command of the force was Revolutionary War here, General Anthony Wayne. Nicknamed “Mad” for his impetuous and daring attacks against the British in that war, General Wayne instead elected for a methodical and remorseless campaign against the Native Americans. Dubbing this new US army a “Legion”, it was divided into for “sub-legions”, each of which was a combined-arms force of regular as well as militia infantry, dragoons, artillery and engineers.

The Legion drilled extensively after forming near Pittsburgh. The force then traveled down the Ohio River and after disembarking in Cincinnati began its march north into the heart of the Native American territory.

Can you do as well, or better? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of Walking a Bloody Path is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
96 double-sided, un-mounted counters
One 20 page rules booklet with color illustrations and designer notes.

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and determine some game events. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards, and can be used with all of the games in the Battles of the Old Northwest Series, is also available. Walking a Bloody Path is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Nils Johansson.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Mirror Image (Mothership)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trouble Comes in Twos...
The Planet of Mire is expanding; new contracts for surveying and colonizing make it the ideal destination for any group of spacefarers looking to make their mark. While preparations are underway for a lucrative expedition, a group of contractors are set to enjoy an all-expenses paid stay at a premier luxury hotel in Mire’s capital city of Rosha Des. But events set in motion by unseen forces set them up with a night to remember...even if they’d prefer to forget...

Players will experience the surreal and bizarre as they navigate through emotional strain and moral conundrums in a hostile environment. With multiple endings and outcomes, they may decide the fates of all those involved at The Menagerie. Will they discover the truth? Or remain blessed with ignorance?

Inside you will find:

A 25-page, fully illustrated, adventure of psychological horror compatible with Mothership RPG.
A new planet, Mire, usable with most any setting.
A dangerous, mind-bending tale for 3-6 characters of any level.
4-8 hours of gameplay, depending on play style.

boardgame.name: Unconventional Heroes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Themes- As Unexpected as They Are Familiar

This book explores a number of themes that, at face value, seem familiar to you due to their presence in popular media but within the context of their own story are rare.

Includes

Antiquated Noble: Born into a universe that has left you behind, you are a relic of a bygone age who has had to adapt to the current era. You are a master of tradition, ancient weapons like full plate and iron swords, and antiquated skills but you find surprising ways to adapt them to a world of spaceships and laser guns!
Battle School Student: You were raised in a brutal battle school to be a living weapon! Will you be more or just remain a weapon for your handlers to use?!
Child Prodigy: Born with incredible talent you suffer the fate of all child stars- what to do after the limelight has left you?
Destined: There is a prophecy about you which is both a blessing and a curse. Can you rise above the constraints it places upon you or will you crumble under the expectations of being “the chosen one”?
Doom Cursed: Death stalks you, constantly. With one foot in the grave and the Sword of Damoclies hanging over your head can you parlay your dark fate into a winning strategy?
Memory Steward: You are the latest in the line of an oral tradition and have a prodigious memory that allows you to remember just about everything. Locked within your mind are secrets no one else can be trusted with and you must grapple with the idea that lost knowledge might die with you.
Smuggler: Nothing is more dangerous than blockade running; the act of charging headfirst at an armed embargo with the express intent of breaking it. Smugglers are not simple thieves, rogues, or con men- they are daring pilots with a death wish that accept shady contracts for the ultimate payout- GLORY (and money).
Test Subject: You were experimented upon, likely against your will, and somehow managed to survive. Using the skills and talents you stole from them you need to build yourself a life and, just maybe, get some revenge.
Troubadour: Gone are the days when a bard could strum a chord and earn a coin. In the far future troubadours travel the stars plying their trade, DJing for galactic emperors, and spinning embellishing holo-yarns about the gallant battle of Dedrax IV to enthralled crowds on the data net.
Variant Themes: We’ve also included 6 variant themes. They include Field Researcher (Variant Scholar Theme), Neo-Aristocrat (Variant Antiquated Noble Theme), Private Eye (Variant Law Officer Theme), Renegade (Variant Outlaw Theme), Translator (Variant Xenoseeker Theme).

boardgame.name: Temple of Reflection
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4 characters of level 12

The magical security expert Ytrellia De’bouchar had the reputation of a mad genius, so nobody was particularly surprised when she succumbed to the occupational hazard of paranoia and vanished.

Known for her overly complicated but efficient security systems, her erstwhile patrons want to find her and help her recover. One of her last completed vaults, referenced as the “Temple of Reflection” in her sparse remaining design documents, might hold a clue to her whereabouts.

The party must figure out how the notoriously-lethal complex works and document it—every mechanism might be a concealed hint!

boardgame.name: Omphalos: Tarot-Based City Creation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is this?

Do you like "town" sessions? Limping home from a dungeon, counting your filthy lucre, finding an inn, feasting and drinking? Do you like to plan your downtime actions—things you’re doing while staying in the city? Do you like to zoom in on your character's slice of life?

If you answered "yes," this supplement might be for you.

This supplement helps you create an evocative sword-and-sorcery cityscape for tabletop role-playing games using Tarot cards. Randomly create new settlements to populate your campaign setting or build a massive city state for your players to explore.

Each district has a name and a brief description of their most interesting parts.
Each entry includes some sights and sounds visitors might encounter.
Most entries have an example rumor that the GM can use when the players visit that district.
Lastly, each entry has special actions that may be used by adventurers who dwell there.

boardgame.name: Sorcery is a Sword Without a Hilt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is this?
Sorcery is a Sword Without a Hilt is a magic system for OSRish games. It contains 40 level-less spells and dozens of magical catastrophes. The spells are flexible, with variable effects depending on how much "juice" the sorcerer gives them.

Each spell is designed to feel like a weird, useful tool. At the same time, there are no spells that solve the essential problems of dungeon crawling.

Magic feels magical
Sorcerers use components to cast spells. These components are your eye of gnat, tongue of dog, toe of bat variety. Pulling out a pickled, rune-covered tongue and placing it into the mouth of a corpse to cast Speak with Dead inherently makes the sorcerer seem more magical and weird. Additionally, this system makes magic fit into a basic inventory management system. How many spells you have available equals how many pack slots you've dedicated to components.

Additionally, the spell descriptions are somewhat terse. They do not have the precise legalism certain systems have. The GM has a good amount of leeway to interpret the spells as they're cast, creating a sense of manageable mystery.

Magic is a strange Swiss-army knife
With magic, an adventuring party should be able to solve problems in a dramatically different way than without it. A thief can unlock a door and eavesdrop at the threshold. A sorcerer can cast Portable Hole onto the door and peer through it. One is subtle and one is obvious. Both have their drawbacks and advantages.

Magic doesn't solve the essential dungeon problems
At the same time, magic can't solve all of your problems. There are no spells that solve the essential challenges of the dungeon: light, hunger, exhaustion. There are no spells that provide darkvision, conjure food and water, or provide continual light.

boardgame.name: Colors of Paris: First player token
boardgame.description: First player token for Colors of Paris

boardgame.name: The War of Cognac
boardgame.description:
Between 1526 and 1530 a war broke out in Italy which involved the Peninsula from Calabria to Lombardy; often inserted as an “episode” of long Italian Wars of XVI century, the conflict comes also referred to as War of Cognac, from the name of the locality where the treaty of alliance and formed the League between Rome, Florence, Venice, Milan and France against the Emperor Charles V.

The conflict was the first real attempt at Italian independence, fought between Italians against Italians, due to the division in which it is he found the country and the mercenary it was rampant practice in those years.

The game is based on the Thirty Years War system published by GMT Games.

During every turn, players alternate in playing cards for action points or for event. Actions points are used to move armies, fight with enemy, siege a fortress, take control of areas.
Some areas are key area that gives the control player Victory Points. At the end of a scenario (smaller or campaign) the player who has the most VPs is the winner.

boardgame.name: Top Trumps Quiz: Disney
boardgame.description: The Top Trumps Disney version of Winning Moves card game is suitable for children aged 6 and over. Who will be the strongest ? Play with family or friends with this Quiz 500 questions and test your knowledge of the Disney universe.

boardgame.name: Zik: Volume II
boardgame.description:
Zik: Volume 2 is a party game. Players will have to guess which song is sung by a team mate. But players are not allowed to sing the lyrics, they must use onomatopoeia such as gling-gling, tut, boom etc...

Contents: 48 cards with 384 new songs.

boardgame.name: Hein?: Famille & Culture Pop
boardgame.description:
In the game Hein? Famille & Culture Pop ("Huh? Family and Pop Culture"), you try to describe songs, people, places or professions in strange and funny ways. Word, mime, song ... describe your films or your personalities as you want. Because your goal is simple: that as few players as possible understand what you are talking about!

The fewer players who understand, the more points you score. But at least one player must understand!

Be careful not to say too much at the risk of a detail giving the answer to too many players and find around the table which players seem to understand you so that you know when to stop. And above all have fun listening to the absurd descriptions of other players.

boardgame.name: Ricochet: Le Profil de l'Homme Sans Visage
boardgame.description:
Ricochet is a solo or coop game, including a serie of riddle to solve, associating ideas.
The 30 riddles are linked in a crazy secret agents story: evrytime, you have to find the last sentence of a dialog.
To find the missing sentence, the player must hide 20 to 22 words from a grid containing 25 words. The remaining, read in the rignt order and out loud give a hearing rebus wich is the dialog last sentence.

Keep your cool, time is on your side: the faster you will be, the further you will be able to advance on the board. Can be played alone or in teams. With over 1000 crazy questions!

boardgame.name: The Fae Queens
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The fae realm is known for its amusing beauty, just like the faeries, but are they really beautiful though? Or is it all just an illusion veil created by them so they look that pretty? How much do you really know about the fae realm? Did you know it is commanded by three terrifying creatures who hold the title of “Queens”? In this mini zine you will see what are the true nature of these so called queens.

This is an eight-page mini zine that can be printed and build up on a single A4 sheet of paper. It contain 3 different fae queens with their detailed discription.

boardgame.name: Clashes
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Clashes is a small supplement designed for Beak, Feather & Bone that introduces rules for events, changes and occurrences that happen as you play. You'll need a copy of Beak, Feather & Bone to play.

Clashes are designed to bring action and change into your game of Beak, Feather & Bone. It's one page of rules for introducing events into your town. You might describe how an NPCs rivalry makes its mark on the city or how a building - once important - is found to be crumbling and unstable.

boardgame.name: Quizduell Master
boardgame.description: The most popular quiz app in Germany can now be played as a board game at master level! Quizduell Master allows up to six players to compete simultaneously at the gaming table with over 1,800 trivia questions of 3 difficulty levels. Players can customize the game to play a traditional quiz duel, play in teams, or compete in tournament mode.

boardgame.name: For Northwood! A Solo Trick-Taking Game
For Northwood! Un Juego de Bazas en Solitario
boardgame.description:
For Northwood! Is a solo hand management and precision trick-taking game. Your objective is to peacefully unify the kingdom of Northwood through conversations with their rulers. Over eight rounds, you must visit eight animal fiefs and engage their rulers in dialogue (tricks). Each ruler's suit represents the trump for that fief. Each ruler also requires you to win an exact number of tricks to join your alliance, so the game gets harder as your options dwindle.

You start with four allies, each with an ability that you can use once per visit. These abilities can make you draw, discard, or otherwise manipulate your hand to help you hit the target score. Once you've won a ruler over, you can pull them in to substitute temporarily for one of your allies, if you need a more specific set of abilities to tackle the harder fiefs.

With multiple difficulty levels, 24 rulers (12 used per game), and a 16-scenario challenge booklet, For Northwood! offers hours of gameplay with a new puzzle every time!

Winner of *Best Overall Game* and *Jury Prize* in the 2021 BGG 54-card contest.
Also winner of *Best Art*, *Best Solo Game*, and *Best New Designer*!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Bone Age
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Bone Age is an old-school RPG of neolithic-era tribes struggling against the sudden arrival of bug-eyed aliens. You play a Tuzanian, a tribe of jungle-dwelling, vine-swinging, pterodactyl-riding, bone-wielding savages, or a Cruach, giant-crab riding cave-dwellers living in mountains bordering the jungle. Radiation leaked from the Invaders' crashed flying saucers spreads on winds of purple, blue, and white, mutating the land and its inhabitants. Meanwhile, a race of turtle-apes and ape-turtles sleeping in stasis beneath the surface awoke...1,000,000 years later than planned. And they were not impressed by the native population – or the alien Invaders.

The Bone Age isn't based on a specific OSR system, but comparisons can be drawn to Swords & Wizardry, Labyrinth Lord, Lamentations of the Flame Princess, and Dungeon Crawl Classics. The base mechanic uses a d20 where higher rolls are better than low rolls, and works in a similar fashion to the way saving throws and attacks work in Labyrinth Lord. Thus, an ability might be expressed as 12+, meaning you want to roll a 12 or higher on a d20. Placing the target number in the hands of the players means they get the thrill of shouting "My attack hits!" or the agony of lamenting "I failed my mutation roll," as opposed to the Game Master setting a secret Difficulty Class.

The Bone Age uses a class & level system, with levels maxing out at 10. While most of game mechanics in The Bone Age will seem familiar, there are some things that stand out in contrast to many other games. The most important is the concept of Attunement. The land of The Bone Age – called Kalsentia – is itself a living entity, and the creatures that inhabit it can develop a spiritual connection to various geographic regions. These regions are represented by hexes on a map. If you are attuned to a hex, you function more effectively in it. You can attempt to attune to new regions, but you risk the wrath of the land if you offend it – rock slides, earthquakes, and floods are just some of the signs that you have angered Kalsentia.The land is brutally hot. The north is dry, the south is humid. Many regions see rain only once per solar cycle.

User summary:

The game is distributed as a 92-page game document and a 54-page "Game Master's Toolkit".

boardgame.name: Stunt Kites
boardgame.description:
It is a breezy beautiful day, so grab your kite and show off your skills. You and your opponent will be flying dual-line stunt kites, pulling off spectacular tricks in a timed routine. Maintain control of the two strings and use the wind to maneuver your kite. Put on the best show by chaining together tricks and you’ll win the judges over.

Stunt Kites is a 2 player worker placement micro game. Use your hands to push and pull your kite into position to perform tricks and earn points. The player that earns the most points by the end of the game wins.

The game is played in rounds and on their turn a player places one of their two Hand cards on a central Pilot card. These Hand cards act as workers and can block out actions from the other player. The placement of the worker allows movement and rotation of a player's Kite card on a grid. If the kite is in the required position and orientation on their grid, they can perform a trick earning them points. Players can plan to do more tricks but must be careful to not get caught with unperformed tricks at the end of the game as those result in penalties.

When there are no Trick cards left in the Trick deck, the Final Trick is revealed. When either player lands that trick, they claim it and the game ends immediately. The player that scored the most points from tricks after applying penalties wins.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Violet and the Grumpy Nisse
boardgame.description:
In Violet and the Grumpy Nisse, one player is Violet and the other is Torech, the very grumpy nisse (a creature from Nordic folklore similar to a gnome) who has been kicked out of every single household in the village and taken shelter in the woods, which he claimed as his own domain.

Now, Violet is setting out to meet with her friend Ordep, the friendly troll, a journey that takes her right through the woods that Torech has claimed for himself. After being kicked out of the village, Torech cannot stand the idea of a human invading his home, let alone a human who is friends with a troll! So he is out to make Violet's journey as unpleasant as he possibly can, playing all sorts of tricks on her.

Violet and the Grumpy Nisse is a two-player trick-taking game. Players take different approaches on how to play this game depending on who they are playing as:


Violet has control over the pacing of the game, but is also more vulnerable to losing tricks as she has to manage her lantern, making sure it's always fueled so that she doesn't get lost in the darkness of the woods at night. She also wasn't expecting a nisse to cross her path; this can be scary, and she has to manage her fear so not to be overwhelmed by her own paranoia.
Torech has very little control over the pacing of the game, but he does has a few tricks up his sleeve. As Violet's fear of him increases, he becomes bolder and sets out more and more traps that make it harder for Violet to reach her friend. Also, unlike Violet, losing a trick is not nearly as bad for Torech as it is for Violet. He, after all, is the master of tricks!


The game ends with a win for Violet if she reaches the end of her journey. Torech wins if Violet's lantern runs out of fuel, or if her fear sneaks up on her before she gets to Ordep.

What's unique about this trick taking game:

It's highly thematic and instead of keeping track of scores on a pad, you will have Violet's pawn advancing on a map, that displays her progress and how close/far she is from winning the game.
Torech has two tracks on the board he will be focusing on and that display how close/far he is from winning the game: Violet's fear, which he threatens with each trick he successfully plays on her (wins), and Violet's Light track, which he wants to run out as quickly as possible so that she gets lost.
Trump will change over the course of a game as Violet journeys through the different parts of the landscape. Because Violet controls the pacing, she will be able to speed through them, or stay for a little longer to take advantage of a certain suit.
Most cards have a special ability, however, a card's ability is triggered only if it isn't used as a trump (trump is determined by Violet's location on the map).
Thanks to the many different traps Torech can use, each game will have different events play out at different timings, depending on how early Violet becomes a victim of her own fears.
